newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Richina sees significant turnaround.
newsitem.headline: Richina sees significant turnaround.

text.p: Richina Pacific Ltd said on Thursday it expects lower profits in the six months to June 30 but it expects a significant turnaround in the second six months, enabling it to comfortably exceed last year's profit.
At the annual meeting chairman Jim Syme forecast the current financial year would be one of two widely varying halves.
Richina was currently in an investment phase, and was focusing on three projects - Mobil-on-the-Park in Wellington, an underwater aquarium and a leather making operation in China.
"As we move to establish these investments, particularly those in China, we are incurring anticipated start up costs" he said.

"While profits in NZ operations for the first quarter were at the same level as last year, the impact of the Chinese expenses and losses mean that we do not expect our profits, in the six months ending June 30 to achieve the same level as in the same period last year.

"However, we expect a significant turnaround in our second six months and to comfortably exceed last year's profits for the period. This pattern of six monthly improvement is from then on expected to continue," he said.
